Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Smoothly \Smooth"ly\, adv. In a smooth manner. [1913 Webster]

smoothly adv 1: with no problems or difficulties; "put the plans into effect quickly and smoothly" 2: with great ease and success; "in spite of some mishaps, everything went swimmingly" [syn: {swimmingly}] 3: in a smooth and diplomatic manner; "`And now,' he said smoothly, `we will continue the conversation'"
